intentrecipientChannelId of the withdraw intent"},"intendSettle(bytes)":{"details":"simplex states in this array are not necessarily in the same channel,  which means intendSettle natively supports multi-channel batch processing.  A simplex state with non-zero seqNum (non-null state) must be co-signed by both peers,  while a simplex state with seqNum=0 (null state) only needs to be signed by one peer.  TODO: wait for Solidity's support to replace SignedSimplexStateArray with bytes[].","params":{"_signedSimplexStateArray":"bytes of SignedSimplexStateArray message"}},"intendWithdraw(bytes32,uint256,bytes32)":{"details":"only peers can call intendWithdraw","params":{"_amount":"amount of funds to withdraw","_channelId":"ID of the channel","_recipientChannelId":"withdraw to receiver address if 0,  otherwise deposit to receiver address in the recipient channel"}},"isOwner()":{"details":"Returns true if the caller is the current owner."},"migrateChannelFrom(address,bytes)":{"params":{"_fromLedgerAddr":"the old ledger address to migrate from","_migrationRequest":"bytes of migration request message"}},"migrateChannelTo(bytes)":{"params":{"_migrationRequest":"bytes of migration request message"},"return":"migrated channel id"},"openChannel(bytes)":{"params":{"_openRequest":"bytes of open channel request message"}},"owner()":{"details":"Returns the address of the current owner."},"renounceOwnership()":{"details":"Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner."},"setBalanceLimits(address[],uint256[])":{"params":{"_limits":"balance limits of the tokens","_tokenAddrs":"addresses of the tokens (address(0) is for ETH)"}},"snapshotStates(bytes)":{"details":"simplex states in this array are not necessarily in the same channel,  which means snapshotStates natively supports multi-channel batch processing.  This function only updates seqNum, transferOut, pendingPayOut of each on-chain  simplex state. It can't ensure that the pending pays will be cleared during  settling the channel, which requires users call intendSettle with the same state.  TODO: wait for Solidity's support to replace SignedSimplexStateArray with bytes[].","params":{"_signedSimplexStateArray":"bytes of SignedSimplexStateArray message"}},"transferOwnership(address)":{"details":"Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner."},"vetoWithdraw(bytes32)":{"details":"only peers can veto a withdrawal intent;  peers can veto a withdrawal intent even after (requestTime + disputeTimeout)","params":{"_channelId":"ID of the channel"}}},"title":"CelerLedger wrapper contract"},"userdoc":{"methods":{"clearPays(bytes32,address,bytes)":{"notice":"Read payment results and add results to corresponding simplex payment channel"},"confirmSettle(bytes32)":{"notice":"Confirm channel settlement"},"confirmWithdraw(bytes32)":{"notice":"Confirm channel channel's balance info (depositMap and withdrawalMap)"},"getCelerWallet()":{"notice":"Return CelerWallet used by this CelerLedger contract"},"getChannelMigrationArgs(bytes32)":{"notice":"Return channel-level migration arguments"},"getChannelStatus(bytes32)":{"notice":"Get channel status"},"getChannelStatusNum(uint256)":{"notice":"Return channel number of given status in this contract"},"getCooperativeWithdrawSeqNum(bytes32)":{"notice":"Get cooperative withdraw seqNum"},"getDisputeTimeout(bytes32)":{"notice":"Return channel's dispute transferOut map of a duplex channel"},"getWithdrawIntent(bytes32)":{"notice":"Return the withdraw intent info of the channel"},"intendSettle(bytes)":{"notice":"Intend to settle channel(s) with an array of signed simplex states"},"intendWithdraw(bytes32,uint256,bytes32)":{"notice":"Intend to withdraw funds from channel"},"migrateChannelFrom(address,bytes)":{"notice":"Migrate a channel from an old CelerLedger to this CelerLedger"},"migrateChannelTo(bytes)":{"notice":"Migrate a channel from this CelerLedger to a new CelerLedger"},"openChannel(bytes)":{"notice":"Open a state channel through auth withdraw message"},"setBalanceLimits(address[],uint256[])":{"notice":"Set the per-channel balance limits of given tokens"},"snapshotStates(bytes)":{"notice":"Store signed simplex states on-chain as checkpoints"},"vetoWithdraw(bytes32)":{"notice":"Veto current withdrawal intent"}},"notice":"A wrapper contract using libraries to provide CelerLedger's APIs.Ownable contract and LedgerBalanceLimit library should only be used  in the initial stage of the mainnet operation for a very short period of  time to limit the balance amount that can be deposit into each channel,  so that any losses due to unknown bugs (if any) will be limited. The balance  limits should be disabled and the owner account of CelerLedger should renounce  its ownership after the system is stable and comprehensively params._channelId: ID of the channel
params._payIdList: bytes of a pay hash list
params._peerFrom: address of the peer who send out funds

confirmSettle(bytes32).details: This must be called after settleFinalizedTime

params._channelId: ID of the channel

confirmWithdraw(bytes32).details: anyone can confirm a withdrawal intent

params._channelId: ID of the channel

params._settleRequest: bytes of cooperative settle request message

params._cooperativeWithdrawRequest: bytes of cooperative withdraw request message

deposit(bytes32,address,uint256).details: total deposit amount = msg.value(must be 0 for ERC20) + _transferFromAmount

params._channelId: ID of the channel
params._transferFromAmount: amount of funds to be transfered from EthPool for ETH  or ERC20 contract for ERC20 tokens

depositInBatch(bytes32[],address[],uint2.details: do not support sending ETH in msg.value for function simplicity.  Index in three arrays should match.

params._transferFromAmounts: amounts of funds to be transfered from EthPool for ETH  or ERC20 contract for ERC20 tokens

getBalanceMap(bytes32).details: Solidity can't directly return an array of struct for now

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed

getBalanceMap(bytes32).return: addresses of peers in the channelcorresponding deposits of the peers (with matched index)corresponding withdrawals of the peers (with matched index)

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed

getChannelMigrationArgs(bytes32).return: channel dispute timeoutchannel tokey type converted to uintchannel token addresssequence number of cooperative withdraw

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed

params._channelStatus: query channel status converted to uint

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed
ID of the channel to be viewed
ID of the channel to be viewed

getLastPayResolveDeadlineMap(bytes32).return: peers' addresseslastPayResolveDeadlines of two simplex channels

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed
ID of the channel to be viewed

getNextPayIdListHashMap(bytes32).return: peers' addressesnextPayIdListHashes of two simplex channels

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed

getPeersMigrationInfo(bytes32).return: peers' addressespeers' depositspeers' withdrawalspeers' state sequence numberspeers' transferOut mappeers' pendingPayOut map

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed

getPendingPayOutMap(bytes32).return: peers' addressespendingPayOuts of two simplex channels

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed
ID of the channel to be viewed

getStateSeqNumMap(bytes32).return: peers' addressestwo simplex state sequence numbers

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed
ID of the channel to be viewed
ID of the channel to be viewed
ID of the channel to be viewed

getTransferOutMap(bytes32).return: peers' addressestransferOuts of two simplex channels

params._channelId: ID of the channel to be viewed

getWithdrawIntent(bytes32).return: receiver of the withdraw intentamount of the withdraw intentrequestTime of the withdraw intentrecipientChannelId of the withdraw intent

intendSettle(bytes).details: simplex states in this array are not necessarily in the same channel,  which means intendSettle natively supports multi-channel batch processing.  A simplex state with non-zero seqNum (non-null state) must be co-signed by both peers,  while a simplex state with seqNum=0 (null state) only needs to be signed by one peer.  TODO: wait for Solidity's support to replace SignedSimplexStateArray with bytes[].

params._channelId: ID of the channel
params._recipientChannelId: withdraw to receiver address if 0,  otherwise deposit to receiver address in the recipient channel

isOwner().details: Returns true if the caller is the current owner.

params._fromLedgerAddr: the old ledger address to migrate from

params._openRequest: bytes of open channel request message

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner.     * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._tokenAddrs: addresses of the tokens (address(0) is for ETH)

snapshotStates(bytes).details: simplex states in this array are not necessarily in the same channel,  which means snapshotStates natively supports multi-channel batch processing.  This function only updates seqNum, transferOut, pendingPayOut of each on-chain  simplex state. It can't ensure that the pending pays will be cleared during  settling the channel, which requires users call intendSettle with the same state.  TODO: wait for Solidity's support to replace SignedSimplexStateArray with bytes[].

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

vetoWithdraw(bytes32).details: only peers can veto a withdrawal intent;  peers can veto a withdrawal intent even after (requestTime + disputeTimeout)

params._channelId: ID of the channel

clearPays(bytes32,address,bytes).notice: Read payment results and add results to corresponding simplex payment channel

cooperativeWithdraw(bytes).notice: Cooperatively withdraw specific amount of balance

deposit(bytes32,address,uint256).notice: Deposit ETH or ERC20 tokens into the channel

depositInBatch(bytes32[],address[],uint2.notice: Deposit ETH via EthPool or ERC20 tokens into the channel

disableBalanceLimits().notice: Disable balance limits of all tokens

enableBalanceLimits().notice: Enable balance limits of all tokens

getBalanceLimit(address).notice: Return balance limit of given token

getBalanceMap(bytes32).notice: Return one channel's balance info (depositMap and withdrawalMap)

getCelerWallet().notice: Return CelerWallet used by this CelerLedger contract

getChannelStatusNum(uint256).notice: Return channel number of given status in this contract

getEthPool().notice: Return EthPool used by this CelerLedger contract

getLastPayResolveDeadlineMap(bytes32).notice: Return lastPayResolveDeadline map of a duplex channel

getNextPayIdListHashMap(bytes32).notice: Return nextPayIdListHash map of a duplex channel

getPayRegistry().notice: Return PayRegistry used by this CelerLedger contract

getPeersMigrationInfo(bytes32).notice: Return migration info of the peers in the channel

getPendingPayOutMap(bytes32).notice: Return pendingPayOut map of a duplex channel

getSettleFinalizedTime(bytes32).notice: Get channel confirm settle open time

getStateSeqNumMap(bytes32).notice: Return state seqNum map of a duplex channel

getTotalBalance(bytes32).notice: Return one channel's total balance amount

getTransferOutMap(bytes32).notice: Return transferOut map of a duplex channel

getWithdrawIntent(bytes32).notice: Return the withdraw intent info of the channel

intendSettle(bytes).notice: Intend to settle channel(s) with an array of signed simplex states

intendWithdraw(bytes32,uint256,bytes32).notice: Intend to withdraw funds from channel

migrateChannelFrom(address,bytes).notice: Migrate a channel from an old CelerLedger to this CelerLedger

migrateChannelTo(bytes).notice: Migrate a channel from this CelerLedger to a new CelerLedger

openChannel(bytes).notice: Open a state channel through auth withdraw message

setBalanceLimits(address[],uint256[]).notice: Set the per-channel balance limits of given tokens

snapshotStates(bytes).notice: Store signed simplex states on-chain as checkpoints

userdoc.notice: A wrapper contract using libraries to provide CelerLedger's APIs.Ownable contract and LedgerBalanceLimit library should only be used  in the initial stage of the mainnet operation for a very short period of  time to limit the balance amount that can be deposit into each channel,  so that any losses due to unknown bugs (if any) will be limited. The balance  limits should be disabled and the owner account of CelerLedger should renounce  its ownership after the system is stable and comprehensively audited.
